basics.name: Daniel Martins
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary:
I am a passionate and dedicated Electrical and Electronic Engineer, having graduated from Universidade do Algarve in 2013 and completed my master's degree in 2016. My career is driven by a love for technology and a desire to work on innovative and captivating projects that present daily challenges and opportunities for growth.

I specialize in Electronics and Programming, constantly seeking to expand my knowledge and skills through personal projects and inventive solutions. In my free time, I enjoy exploring new technologies and creating unique projects that push the boundaries of what's possible.

I am eager to contribute to forward-thinking teams and projects that value creativity, innovation, and continuous improvement.

work.name: Paycritical - Soluções de Pagamento, Lda
work.summary:
𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄:
- Developed an innovative solution for WYD Lisbon 2023: Enabled restaurants to redeem meals by reading pilgrims QR Codes, streamlining the process for thousands of participants.
- Full-cycle development of DeGrazie: Created a solution that allows restaurants to provide QR Codes on tables, enabling customers to easily read, order, and pay for their meals.

 𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀:
- Backoffice Development: Utilized React to implement a backoffice for merchants to manage QR Codes and define menu products.
- Frontoffice Development: Developed a React-based frontoffice for customers to read QR Codes and seamlessly order and pay for their meals.
- Database Management: Employed SQL for efficient data storage and retrieval.
- Message Queuing: Implemented RabbitMQ for background operations, ensuring smooth and reliable task execution.
- Task Scheduling: Used Hangfire to schedule background operations with a robust retry system.
- Real-time Updates: Leveraged SignalR to read messages from RabbitMQ and automatically update the web app without user refresh.

 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗠𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗼𝗱𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗴𝘆: Agile

 𝗩𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹: GIT

work.name: Omnibees
work.summary:
𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄:
Full-cycle development of Omnibees to enhance hospitality services, ensuring seamless operations and improved customer experiences.

 𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀:
- Developed an API Template (.Net Core): Created a comprehensive API template in .Net Core, featuring authentication, authorization, tracing, health checks, logging, metrics, EF Core for database access and many usefull abstractions.
- Migrated Silverlight to Angular: Transitioned legacy systems to modern frameworks, enhancing performance and user experience.
- Developed Web APIs in C# (.Net Framework): Created robust APIs to support data integration and communication.
- Implement and manage message queuing systems using MSMQ to handle asynchronous processing tasks.
- Implemented distributed caching: Utilized Couchbase and Redis to optimize data retrieval and performance.
- Database Management: Employed SQL for efficient data storage and retrieval, ensuring API efficiency.
- Develop and maintain ETL packages using SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) to extract, transform, and load data from various sources to make API reads more performant.
- Unit Testing: Implemented unit tests using Moq to ensure business logic integrity during refactors.
- Integration Testing: Ensured API endpoints functioned correctly through comprehensive integration tests.
- End-to-End Testing: Applied Cypress tests to validate the entire system's functionality.

 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗠𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗼𝗱𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗴𝘆: Scrum and Kanban

 𝗩𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹: TFSVC and GIT (gitflow and trunkbase depending on the project size)

work.name: Visualforma - Tecnologias de Informação, SA
work.summary:
𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄:
Developed cutting-edge software solutions tailored for the hospitality industry, enhancing operational efficiency and customer experience.

 𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀:
- Develop interactive and rich user interfaces using Silverlight to streamline hospitality operations. This involves creating controls, layouts, and handling user interactions.
- Implemented back-end logic for ASP.NET MVC applications, including creating and managing controllers, views, and models.
- Developed Web APIs in C# (.Net Framework): Created robust and scalable Web APIs to support seamless data integration and communication.
- Utilized SQL for efficient data storage and retrieval, ensuring the API’s optimal performance.
- Implemented unit tests and integration tests for API.

 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗠𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗼𝗱𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗴𝘆: Scrum

 𝗩𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹: TFSVC

work.name: Universidade do Algarve
work.summary:
R&D Engineer at SRM - Smart Revenue Management (QREN I&DT n.º 38962)

 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄:
Led the development of innovative web crawlers to enhance data retrieval from e-commerce websites, significantly improving data warehouse capabilities.

 𝗞𝗲𝘆 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗽𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀:
- Spearheaded the design and implementation of Web Crawlers using Selenium WebDriver, ensuring efficient and accurate data extraction.
- Used C# (.Net Framework) to develop robust and scalable solutions tailored to project requirements.
- Managed and optimized data storage with MongoDB, enhancing data accessibility and performance.
- Applied algorithms to normalize data extracted from different sources.

projects.name: Display(Matriz) de LEDs interativo
projects.description: A LED Display made to be exposed in 'Semana Académica do Algarve' over the bar tend of my course. Led Matrix features: React to sound beats (frequency), Show images, Play Simple Games, Write Messages.
